abstract: Fabrice Tourre, the former Goldman Sachs trader at the center of a toxic mortgage deal sold to investors on the eve of the financial crisis, was found liable on six of the seven civil charges against him.
snippet: Fabrice Tourre, the former Goldman Sachs trader at the center of a toxic mortgage deal sold to investors on the eve of the financial crisis, was found liable on six of the seven civil charges against him.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 10:03 p.m. | A former Goldman Sachs trader at the center of a toxic mortgage deal lost a closely watched legal battle on Thursday, giving Wall Street’s top regulator its first significant courtroom victory in a case stemming from the financial crisis.

headline.main: Former Trader Is Found Liable in Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Former Trader Is Found Liable In Fraud Case

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Ben Protess

abstract: The attorney general sent letters to six banks seeking information about the use of databases that disqualify people seeking to open checking or savings accounts.
snippet: The attorney general sent letters to six banks seeking information about the use of databases that disqualify people seeking to open checking or savings accounts.
lead_paragraph: New York State’s top prosecutor is investigating some of the nation’s largest banks in connection with their use of credit-reporting databases that disqualify people seeking to open checking or savings accounts — an inquiry that has gained urgency as the ranks of the unbanked has swelled in the aftermath of the financial crisis.

headline.main: New York State Investigates Disqualification of Customers by Banks
headline.print_headline: New York Scrutinizes Bank Account Blacklists
